intro: Peucedanum flavum, commonly known as the yellow cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and have a mild, spicy aroma similar to other members of its family.
